Ingredients.Ingredient: ½ lb. ground pork or beef

Instructions.Instruction: Combine the chili garlic sauce, soy sauce, and brown sugar in a bowl.

Add the ground pork to a skillet and cook over medium heat until it is fully browned. Once browned, add the prepared dragon sauce. Allow the pork to simmer in the sauce for another 5 minutes, or until the sauce has reduced by half.
While the pork is browning, begin boiling water for your noodles. Once boiling, add your noodles and cook according to the package directions. Drain the noodles in a colander.
Once the sauce has reduced and the noodles have drained, add the noodles to the skillet and toss until everything is combined and coated in sauce.

Notes.Note: Ground beef can be substituted for ground pork.
If this ends up being too spicy, halve the chili garlic sauce and only use ¾ of what's called for brown sugar.

Instructions.Instruction: Pre-heat oven according to directions on crescent roll tube.
Slice down middle of hot dog. Using a slice of velveeta cheese, break it into ¼ pieces, placing 2 pieces in the slits of the hot dogs
Roll the cheese filled hot dog inside of a crescent roll.
Cook according to directions on crescent roll tube, or until golden brown.
Add the oyster sauce, brown sugar, soy sauce and canola oil to a bowl and stir until combined.
Bring a large pot of water to a boil and cook the noodles according to the package directions (boil for 7-10 minutes). Drain the cooked noodles in a colander, then set aside.

While the pasta cooks, mince the garlic. Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium-low heat. Once the butter is melted and bubbly, add the garlic and saut√© until they are soft and fragrant (1-2 minutes).

Remove the skillet from the heat. Add the drained pasta and oyster sauce mixture to the skillet, and stir well to coat the pasta. If your pasta is stiff or sticky making it hard to stir, sprinkle a small amount of hot water over the pasta to loosen it up.

Ingredients.Ingredient: as much cornstarch necessary (about ½ cup)

Instructions.Instruction: Combine the marmalade with the soy sauce, brown sugar, rice vinegar, grated ginger, minced garlic, red pepper flakes, and 1/2 Tbsp cornstarch in a small sauce pot. Before placing it over heat, whisk until the cornstarch is fully dissolved. Heat the mixture over medium-low until it begins to simmer, thicken, and turns into a glossy glaze (about 3-5 minutes). Remove the sauce from heat and set it aside
Use a sharp knife to remove any excess fat from the chicken thighs, then cut them into small 3/4-inch pieces.
Heat oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Beat egg by hand in bowl. Place chicken in bowl.
In another bowl or plate, pour out a good amount of cornstarch. Take egg-coated piece of chicken and hand toss in cornstarch before adding to hot oiled pan. Add in more cornstarch as needed.

Let the pieces cook until they are golden brown on the bottom. Flip the chicken pieces, breaking them apart from one another as you turn them. Let them cook until golden brown on the second side and cooked through (about 5-7 minutes total cooking).
Turn the heat off under the skillet and pour on the prepared orange sauce. Stir to coat the chicken pieces in sauce
Pre-heat oven to 350°F
Cook the package of macaroni, drain, and let cool.
While the macaroni is cooking, melt the butter/margarine in a pan. Brown the onion in it. Add the hambuger and brown well; drain.
Combine onion/hamburger, macaroni, and pizza sauce into a greased casserole dish.
Sprinkle american and parmesan cheese over top.
Place in oven and bake 45 min - 1 hour, until cheese is melted.

Notes.Note: Other pizza toppings, such as mushrooms or pepperoni, can be added.

Ingredients.Ingredient: ½ cup pizza sauce for dipping

Instructions.Instruction: Pre-heat oven to 400°F.
Microwave 4 tortillas with a damp paper towel on them for 20 seconds. Microwave the second batch when ready.
Place 5 pepperoni on the bottom of the tortilla, 2 in a row, then 3 in a row on above them.
Place the mozzarella stick on top of the pepperoni, tuck in the ends, and roll tightly.
Place on a greased baking sheet, putting a small amount of oil on top of the rolls.
Bake for 10 - 15 min, until lightly browned.
Serve with pizza sauce for dipping.

Ingredients.Ingredient: ½ cup grated Parmesan or Romero cheese
⅓ cup of the water from the noodles

Instructions.Instruction: Combine eggs and yolk in a bowl, blend well.
Add cheese to eggs and blend with a fork, and season with black pepper.
Slice the bacon into large chunks.
In a cold non-stick pan, add the bacon and turn the heat to medium.
Once the bacon is fully cooked, strain out most of the grease, leaving about 2 tbsp in the pan.
Turn the pan to low and add the garlic, minced. Sauté for 1 minute and turn off heat.
Add the noodles to a pot of heavily salted water and cook.
Remove the noodles from the pot, reserving at least ⅓ cup of the starchy water. Place them in the pan with the bacon.
Add the egg and cheese mixture to the pan, stirring constantly to cook the eggs as to not allow them to scramble.
Taste test/check for sauce thickness. If the sauce is too thick, add some of the starch water. If too thin, add more grated cheese.

Notes.Note: Any type of noodle can be used. I prefer spaghetti, Babish recommended bucatini.

Ingredients.Ingredient: ¼ - ⅓ cup of cheese (mexican blend, sharp/regular cheddar)
Any other sides/toppings you may want (black beans, sour cream, salsa, lettuce, etc)

Instructions.Instruction: Cook chicken patty so that it's crispy (microwave then in a pan on medium heat, or in the oven).
In a medium pan, place the tortilla on low-medium heat. Sprinkle cheese evenly, allow to melt almost fully.
Cut crisped chicken patty into approximately 7-8 strips.
Place strips onto ½ of the tortilla, spreading across from one side to the other.
Fold over the tortilla. Brown each side lightly, then serve.
Preheat oven to 350°F.
Place bagels onto baking sheet, cut in half.
Spread sauce onto bagels.
Cover in cheese.
Place toppings.
Place in oven for 8-10 minutes, or until cheese is melted.
